snippet: The airline’s board voted in favor of an Italian government plan to have the Italian postal service invest in the struggling carrier, an idea that was met with skepticism by many analysts.
abstract: Alitalia's board, struggling to stave off airline's imminent collapse, votes in favor of Italian government plan to have the Italian postal service invest in the struggling airline; rescue package of 500 million euros, or $676 million, will likely result in carrier's partial renationalization five years after it was rescued from bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: The airline’s board voted in favor of an Italian government plan to have the Italian postal service invest in the struggling carrier, an idea that was met with skepticism by many analysts.

headline.main: Alitalia Board Approves $676 Million Rescue Plan
headline.print_headline: Alitalia Board Approves $676 Million Rescue Plan
